Description: Public policy think tank in Washington DC founded in 1916. Focusses on both domestic and foreign US policy.
Foreign policy think tank founded in 1910 with offices in Washington DC, Beijing, Beirut, Brussels and New Delhi which produces regular publications on US foreign policy and security interests.

Organisation: Center for Strategic and International Studies
Description: CSIS is a think tank based in Washington DC, founded as part of Georgetown University in 1962 which focuses on issues concerning international relations, trade, technology, finance, energy and geostrategy.

Organisation: Chatham House (The Royal Institute of International Affairs)
Description: An international foreign affairs think tank and NGO based in London and founded in 1920 which is a largely membership-based organisation.
The IISS is a London-based think tank, founded in 1958, which produces research and advises governments and corporates on security and foreign policy.
A conservative think tank based in Washington DC which was founded in 1973, which has a high influence on the policy direction of the Trump administration.
The PIIE is a think tank founded in 1981 which publishes research and policy recommendations on international economics.

Organisation: Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars
Description: A United States Presidential Memorial organisation and think tank based in Washington DC founded in 1945 providing funding for academics and running research programmes for most regions.
The CAP is a progressive centre-left think tank and policy institute founded in 2003 with close links to the Clinton and Obama presidential campaigns.
The RAND (Research and Development) Corporation is a public policy think tank which was created to offer research to the US Armed Forces, advising on issues of national security.
A foreign and security policy think tank, member organisation and publisher founded in 1921 which provides comprehensive coverage on all regions.
The Cato institute is a free-market public policy think tank which often criticises foreign policy from a non-interventionist perspective.
Leadership figures & background: David Boaz (Executive Vice President) Peter Goettler (President and CEO)

Description: Human Rights Watch is an NGO headquartered in New York founded in 1978. The organisation conducts research and advocacy on human rights and works via putting pressure on governments.
The American Enterprise Institute for Public Policy Research is a conservative think tank based in Washington DC and founded in 1938.
An NGO based in London and founded in 1961 which runs international campaigns for human rights via legal advocacy, awareness campaigns, research and lobbying.
IDEAs is a foreign policy think tank based at the London School of Economics was founded in 2008.
Leadership figures & background: Professors Michael Cox and Christopher Coker (co-Directors)

Description: A London-based think tank founded in 1983 which conducts economic research and publishes work on a media platform called VoxEU.
A Washington based think thank that carries out economic and social policy research, originally focused upon 'urgan' problems and Great Society initiatives.
The Royal United Services Institute for Defence and Security Studies is an international security and defence think tank founded in 1831.
Foreign policy think tank based in Washington DC, founded in 1961, with an 'Atlanticist' outlook.
The Institute of Economic Affairs is a free-market, neoliberal think tank based in London and founded in 1955. It was highly influential during the premiership of Margaret Thatcher.
A London-based think tank which focuses on international development and humanitarian issues.
Research centre within Harvard University, founded in 1973 which focusses on international security's intersection with science, technology and climate policy.
The Centre for European reform is a pro-European think tank based in London which researches all aspects of Europe-wide policy.
UK based think tank, focused on international development.
